articles.title: Douglas CARES closing immediately

articles.title: ODF plans virtual informational session on Forest Management Plan proposed rule changes

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: The National Marine Fisheries Service and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has determined that two coastal Chinook salmon groups, the Oregon Coast and the Southern Oregon and Northern California Coastal populations, do not warrant protection under the Endangered Species Act.
articles.title: NMFS denies Oregon, California coastal Chinook salmon status under Endangered Species Act

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Coos County man faces multiple felony charges, including murder and kidnapping, after a fatal shooting in Coos Bay. Police say the suspect disrupted his arraignment and is accused of killing a man in a Staples parking lot and threatening another victim.
articles.title: Coos County Man Arraigned on Murder, Kidnapping Charges After Courthouse Disruption

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man faces multiple charges after allegedly breaking into a home and leaving behind his wallet at the scene. Police say the suspect fled before officers arrived but was later identified and jailed on burglary and theft charges.
articles.title: Wallet Left Behind Leads to Arrest in Roseburg Burglary Case

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Wanda Olsrud, longtime Southern Oregon philanthropist and co-founder of the Sherm’s Thunderbird and Food 4 Less brands, has died at age 100. Her decades of quiet generosity helped shape local communities, youth programs, and healthcare across the region.
articles.title: Longtime Southern Oregon Philanthropist Wanda Olsrud Dies at 100
